page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE RHU AREA
page.content: The D_Block which has been allocated to our school lies just north of the Highland Boundary Fault Line which separates the Highlands of Scotland from the Lowlands and is centred on the Gareloch which is a fiord formed by a glacier gouging down the valleys to join the Clyde glacier.The block takes in most of our village of Rhu,the adjoining community of Shandon and the village of Clynder which lies across the Gareloch on the Rosneath Peninsula.All three communities are similar in character in that they are all rural districts with little scope for extensive development due to the nature of the terrain and therefore, not densely populated with a total of less than 2,500.Although in an area of scenic beauty,we tend to receive mainly passing tourists which explains the lack of guest houses in our block.
